title: Ticket #4937: Fix time zone handling in ClassAds
description:
When parsing an absTime value that doesn't have a time zone offset, the ClassAd library calculates the start and end of DST in the local time zone incorrectly. The times of switching to/from DST are off by the local zone's offset from UTC.

AbsTime values within that several-hour window will be converted to the wrong UTC time (off by an hour in either direction).

In time zones that follow the US's DST rules, this bug can be observed by evaluating the following expression: 

absTime("2002-10-27T17:30:00")-absTime("2002-10-27T02:30:00")

The result should be 

relTime("15:00:00")

With the bug, the result is 

relTime("16:00:00")
remarks:
2015-Mar-13 11:23:36 by jfrey:
Also, the time zone part of an absTime value is unparsed incorrectly. The hours and minutes of the time zone offset should be separated by a colon.
